questions.text: A sign with this shape means:
questions.explanation: Follow posted signs and standard right-of-way, signaling, and safety practices for predictable driving.

questions.text: A red painted curb means you may:
options: Stop to load or unload only
Stop to pick up or drop off passengers only
questions.explanation: Follow posted signs and standard right-of-way, signaling, and safety practices for predictable driving.

questions.text: A green lighted arrow on a traffic light means you may:
options: Proceed in the direction of the arrow after you have come to a complete stop
Not proceed in the direction of the arrow
Proceed in the direction of the arrow without stopping
questions.explanation: Signal indications control movement: a red arrow prohibits turning; flashing lights require stop or caution as posted.

questions.text: A sign with this shape means:
questions.explanation: Follow posted signs and standard right-of-way, signaling, and safety practices for predictable driving.

questions.text: You are approaching an intersection where the lighted arrow has just changed to yellow:
options: You must stop and wait for the light to turn green
You should slow down and turn with caution
You may turn only if you can clear the intersection before the light changes to red
questions.explanation: Signal indications control movement: a red arrow prohibits turning; flashing lights require stop or caution as posted.

questions.text: Unless prohibited by a sign, a left turn on red is permitted:
options: From a two-way road to a one-way road
From a one-way road to a one-way road
questions.explanation: Signal and position into the correct lane before turning; complete the turn into the proper lane unless posted otherwise.
